tripleplay.ui

Class Scroller

  • java.lang.Object
    • tripleplay.ui.Element<T>
      • tripleplay.ui.Container<T>
        • tripleplay.ui.Composite<Scroller>
          • tripleplay.ui.Scroller
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Iterable<Element<?>>

    public class Scroller
extends Composite<Scroller>
    A composite element that manages horizontal and vertical scrolling of a single content element. As shown below, the content can be thought of as moving around behind the scroll group, which is clipped to create a "view" to the content. Methods xpos() and ypos() allow reading the current position of the view. The view position can be set with scroll(float, float). The view size and content size are available via viewSize() and contentSize(). 
    Scrolled view (xpos,ypos>0)       View unscrolled (xpos,ypos=0)
     ---------------------------        ---------------------------
     |                :        |        | Scroll  |               |
     |   content      : ypos   |        | Group   |               |
     |                :        |        |  "view" |               |
     |           -----------   |        |----------               |
     |           | Scroll  |   |        |                         |
     |---xpos--->| Group   |   |        |                         |
     |           |  "view" |   |        |         content         |
     |           -----------   |        |                         |
     ---------------------------        ---------------------------

    Scroll bars are overlaid at the edges of the view and fade out after a short period of inactivity. By default, bars are drawn as simple semi-transparent overlays. The color, size and overall rendering can be overridden with styles.

    NOTE: scroller is a composite container, so callers can't add to or remove from it. To "add" elements, callers should set content to a Group and add things to it.

    NOTE: since scrolling is done by pointer events, child elements cannot be clicked directly. Instead, basic click handling can be done using the contentClicked() signal.

    TODO: some way to handle keyboard events (complicated by lack of a focus element) TODO: more features when Mouse.hasMouse: show some paging buttons when bars are moused over TODO: optional gutter for scroll bars? TODO: more support for interacting with child elements

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static class  Scroller.Bars
      Handles the appearance and animation of scroll bars.
      static class  Scroller.BarType
      Handles creating the scroll bars.
      static class  Scroller.Behavior
      Defines the directions available for scrolling.
      static interface  Scroller.Clippable
      Interface for customizing how content is clipped and translated.
      static interface  Scroller.Listener
      Listens for changes to the scrolling area or offset.
      static class  Scroller.Range
      A range along an axis for representing scroll bars.
      static class  Scroller.TouchBars
      Plain rectangle scroll bars that fade out, ideal for drag scrolling.

    • Field Detail

      • BAR_TYPE

        public static final Style<Scroller.BarType> BAR_TYPE
        The type of bars to use.

        Scroll ranges.

        Scroll ranges.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Scroller

        public Scroller(Element<?> content)
        Creates a new scroll group containing the given content and with Behavior#BOTH.

        If the content is an instance of Scroller.Clippable, then translation will occur via that interface. Otherwise, the content's layer translation will be set directly. Graphics level clipping is always performed.

    • Method Detail

      • findScrollParent

        public static Scroller findScrollParent(Element<?> elem)
        Finds the closest ancestor of the given element that is a Scroller, or null if there isn't one. This uses the tripleplay ui hierarchy.

      • makeVisible

        public static boolean makeVisible(Element<?> elem)
        Attempts to scroll the given element into view.
        Returns:
        true if successful

      • setBehavior

        public Scroller setBehavior(Scroller.Behavior beh)
        Sets the behavior of this scroller.

      • addListener

        public void addListener(Scroller.Listener lner)
        Adds a listener to be notified of this scroller's changes.

      • removeListener

        public void removeListener(Scroller.Listener lner)
        Removes a previously added listener from this scroller.

      • xpos

        public float xpos()
        Returns the offset of the left edge of the view area relative to that of the content.

      • ypos

        public float ypos()
        Returns the offset of the top edge of the view area relative to that of the content.

      • scrollX

        public void scrollX(float x)
        Sets the left edge of the view area relative to that of the content. The value is clipped to be within its valid range.

      • scrollY

        public void scrollY(float y)
        Sets the top edge of the view area relative to that of the content. The value is clipped to be within its valid range.

      • scroll

        public void scroll(float x,
          float y)
        Sets the left and top of the view area relative to that of the content. The values are clipped to be within their respective valid ranges.

      • queueScroll

        public void queueScroll(float x,
               float y)
        Sets the left and top of the view area relative to that of the content the next time the container is laid out. This is needed if the caller invalidates the content and needs to then set a scroll position which may be out of range for the old size.

      • contentSize

        public pythagoras.f.IDimension contentSize()
        Gets the size of the content that we are responsible for scrolling. Scrolling is active for a given axis when this is larger than viewSize() along that axis.

      • viewSize

        public pythagoras.f.IDimension viewSize()
        Gets the size of the view which renders some portion of the content.

      • contentClicked

        public react.Signal<Pointer.Event> contentClicked()
        Gets the signal dispatched when a pointer click occurs in the scroll group. This happens only when the drag was not far enough to cause appreciable scrolling.
